definitions.text: the upper part of the human body or the front part of the body in animals; contains the face and brains
examples: he stuck his head out the window

definitions.text: a single domestic animal
examples: 200 head of cattle

definitions.text: that which is responsible for one's thoughts and feelings; the seat of the faculty of reason
examples: his mind wandered
I couldn't get his words out of my head

definitions.text: a person who is in charge
examples: the head of the whole operation

definitions.text: the front of a military formation or procession
examples: the head of the column advanced boldly
they were at the head of the attack

definitions.text: the pressure exerted by a fluid
examples: a head of steam

definitions.text: the top of something
examples: the head of the stairs
the head of the page
the head of the list

definitions.text: the source of water from which a stream arises
examples: they tracked him back toward the head of the stream

definitions.text: (grammar) the word in a grammatical constituent that plays the same grammatical role as the whole constituent
the tip of an abscess (where the pus accumulates)
the length or height based on the size of a human or animal head
examples: he is two heads taller than his little sister
his horse won by a head

definitions.text: a dense cluster of flowers or foliage
examples: a head of cauliflower
a head of lettuce

definitions.text: the educator who has executive authority for a school
examples: she sent unruly pupils to see the principal

definitions.text: an individual person
examples: tickets are $5 per head

definitions.text: a user of (usually soft) drugs
examples: the office was full of secret heads

definitions.text: a natural elevation (especially a rocky one that juts out into the sea)
a rounded compact mass
examples: the head of a comet

definitions.text: the foam or froth that accumulates at the top when you pour an effervescent liquid into a container
examples: the beer had a large head of foam

definitions.text: the part in the front or nearest the viewer
examples: he was in the forefront
he was at the head of the column

definitions.text: a difficult juncture
examples: a pretty pass
matters came to a head yesterday

definitions.text: forward movement
examples: the ship made little headway against the gale

definitions.text: a V-shaped mark at one end of an arrow pointer
examples: the point of the arrow was due north

definitions.text: the subject matter at issue
examples: the question of disease merits serious discussion
under the head of minor Roman poets

definitions.text: a line of text serving to indicate what the passage below it is about
examples: the heading seemed to have little to do with the text

definitions.text: the rounded end of a bone that fits into a rounded cavity in another bone to form a joint
examples: the head of the humerus

definitions.text: that part of a skeletal muscle that is away from the bone that it moves
(computer science) a tiny electromagnetic coil and metal pole used to write and read magnetic patterns on a disk
(usually plural) the obverse side of a coin that usually bears the representation of a person's head
examples: call heads or tails!

definitions.text: the striking part of a tool
examples: the head of the hammer

definitions.text: (nautical) a toilet on board a boat or ship
a projection out from one end; ,
examples: the head of the nail
a pinhead is the head of a pin

definitions.text: a membrane that is stretched taut over a drum
oral stimulation of the genitals
examples: they say he gives good head

definitions.text: to go or travel towards
examples: where is she heading
We were headed for the mountains

definitions.text: be in charge of
examples: Who is heading this project?

definitions.text: travel in front of; go in advance of others
examples: The procession was headed by John

definitions.text: be the first or leading member of (a group) and excel
examples: This student heads the class

definitions.text: direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
take its rise
examples: These rivers head from a mountain range in the Himalayas

definitions.text: be in the front of or on top of
examples: The list was headed by the name of the president

definitions.text: form a head or come or grow to a head
examples: The wheat headed early this year

definitions.text: remove the head of
examples: head the fish
